hints.content:
There are $\blueD3$ rows with $\purpleC8$ dots in each row.

![The same array with the rows numbered 1 through 3 and the dots in the row numbered 1 through 8](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/68bde365328929dc29aca231997af747ecc4552d)

We can find the total number of dots by adding $\purpleC8$ dots $\blueD3$ times:

![The same array with each row labeled, 8 dots](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/04969d47450b89e256a46f6f60fd24997cbd0018)

$\purpleC8 + \purpleC8 + \purpleC8  = {}?$

![The same array with the dots numbered 1 through 24](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e503ec97014260d7ec60f52a562efffe36cfa090)

$\purpleC8 + \purpleC8 + \purpleC8  = \tealD{24}$

question.content:
Multiplying $3\times8$ is like having $3$ rows of dots with $8$ dots in each row:

![A rectangular array with 3 rows and 8 dots per row](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dc1f80d17a36e3f8143d813354b53ac5290d9c66)

**How many dots are there?**

$3\times8=$ [[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]]
